bibl.title: Four Christian Funerary Inscriptions from the Fayum (I. Deir el-窶連zab 1-4).
bibl.note: Part of the collections of Deir el 窶連zab, better known as the Monastery of Anba Abraam (a few kilometers to the south-east of Medinet el-Fayum). - 1. Tombstone of Menas and Gerontios. Limestone. Arsinoe, 7th-8th cent. - 2. Tombstone of Papas. Limestone. Fayum, ca. 6th-8th cent.? - 3. Tombstone of NN. Limestone, Idem, idem. - 4. Funerary tablet of Phoibammon. Wood. Naqlun (?), Fayum, ca. 6th-8th. cent?
bibl.seg: DERDA Tomasz and Jacques VAN DER VLIET, Four Christian Funerary Inscriptions from the Fayum (I. Deir el-窶連zab 1-4).

Part of the collections of Deir el 窶連zab, better known as the Monastery of Anba Abraam (a few kilometers to the south-east of Medinet el-Fayum). - 1. Tombstone of Menas and Gerontios. Limestone. Arsinoe, 7th-8th cent. - 2. Tombstone of Papas. Limestone. Fayum, ca. 6th-8th cent.? - 3. Tombstone of NN. Limestone, Idem, idem. - 4. Funerary tablet of Phoibammon. Wood. Naqlun (?), Fayum, ca. 6th-8th. cent?
